{{Infobox CHL season | title = 2001â02 OPJHL season | colour = #007AC2 | colour text = #FFFFFF | league = [[Ontario Provincial Junior A Hockey League]] | league abr = OPJHL | logo = | duration = '''Regular season'''
2001-09 â 2002-02
'''Playoffs'''
2002-02 â 2002-04 | champions = [[Brampton Capitals]] | no of teams = 36 | commissioner = [[Bob Hooper (ice hockey)|Bob Hooper]] | prev year = [[2000â01 OPJHL season|2000â01]] | next year = [[2002â03 OPJHL season|2002â03]] }} The '''2001â02 OPJHL [[Season (sports)|season]]''' is the [[List of OJHL seasons|9th]] season of the [[Ontario Provincial Junior A Hockey League]] (OPJHL). The thirty-six teams of the North, South, East, and West divisions competed in a 49-game schedule. Come February, the top eight teams of each division competed for the Frank L. Buckland Trophy, the OPJHL championship. The winner of the Buckland Cup, the [[Brampton Capitals]],http://members.shaw.ca/vernonfranchise/league/cups/national_champions.html did not attend the 2002 [[Dudley Hewitt Cup]] due to a protest staged by the OPJHL against the inclusion of the upstart [[Superior International Junior Hockey League]] in the Central Canadian playdowns. ==Changes== *OPJHL opts out of National Playdowns for one season. *[[Durham Huskies Jr. A|Durham Huskies]] leave the OPJHL. *Port Hope Clippers are renamed [[Port Hope Predators]]. ==Final standings==
